resources.string: InstruMed
Home
About
Open
Close
Is used to clamp deep blood vessels. Burlishers have two closed finger rings. Burlishers with an open finger ring are called tonsil hemotats.Other names: Schnidt tonsil forced, adson forded.
Applier with hemoclips applies metal clips into blood vessels and ducts which will remain occluded.
Is used to clamp larger vessels and tissue. Other names:Rochester Pean.
Is used to clamp small blood vassels.Its jaws may be straight or curved.
Is used to clamp hard-to reach a vessels and to place sutures behind or aroud a vessel. A right angle with a suture attached is called a "tie on a passer". Other names: Mixter.
Are either smooth: used to grasp delicate tissue; or with teeth: used to grasp the skin. Other names: Dura forceps.
Is used to grasp tissue. A "Judd-Allis" holds intestinal tissue; a "heavy allis" holds breast tissue.
aaIs used to grasp delicate tissue (intestine, fallopian tube, ovary)
Is use to hold towels and drapes in place. Other name:Towel clip
Are used to grasp delicate tissue, particularly in cardiovascular surgery
Is used to hold a peanut.
Is used to grasp heavy tissue. May also be used as a clamp. The jaws may be straight or curved. Other names: Ochsner.
Are used to hold needles when suturing.
Are used to grasp tissue

Are used to grasp tough tissue (fascia,breast) forces may either have many teeth or single tooth. Single tooth forces are also called "rat tooth forces". Single tooth forces, many forces (top to bottom).
Is use to retract shallow or superficial incisions. Other names: USA, US Army.
Is used retract wound edges during deep abdominal procedures.
Is used to retract deep abdominal or chest incisions.Available in various widths.
Is used to retract shallow incisions.
Is used to retract shallow or superficial incisions.
Is used to retract deep wounds. May be bent to various shapes
Is used to retract deep abdominal or chest incisions.
Is used to retract shallow incisions.
